data.title: John Boozman
data.text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders is the 47th Governor of Arkansas and the first woman to serve as governor of the state.

Presiding over the state Senate and serving as governor if the governor is otherwise unable to discharge the office’s duties.

The chief law enforcement officer of the state serves as legal representation for the state and its agencies.

Serving as the State’s banker and responsible for an investment portfolio of about $9 billion.

The state’s general accountant and payroll officer for the Executive, Legislative and Judicial branches.

Search all state departments & agencies to discover more about the services they provide in Arkansas.

This collection of resources can help you start, run, and manage your business in the state of Arkansas.

When you are ready to take the time to plan the details of your company’s success, these resources will be your guide.

From licensing to paying taxes and beyond, there are many services available to businesses in Arkansas.

Check for name availability, or gain more information about any business entity filed in the state of Arkansas.

Fostering, promoting, and developing the health, safety and welfare of the wage earners of Arkansas.

Working to foster, promote, and develop the health, safety and welfare of the wage earners of Arkansas.

Protecting employers, employees, and their dependents from financial burdens imposed by job-related injury and disease.

Easily renew your professional licenses and search rosters for professionals holding a license in Arkansas.

Skip the trip to the DMV or reduce your wait time by accessing all of the great services found at mydmv.arkansas.gov

Whether commuting or passing through our state, you can access all road conditions through our mobile app and website.

Many Arkansas counties offer online property tax assessment and payment. Find your county to see if you can take care of this online.

Millions of dollars in unclaimed money and assets are returned to the state every year. See if any of it belongs to you!

Arkansas is known as the “Land of Opportunity”. These resources will help you find your opportunity.

We are committed to providing every citizen with learning opportunities at all levels of education.

Your health is important. Here are the services available help you keep yourself and your family safe and healthy.

Your family matters. Here are the services available to help you take care of all of your family matters.

Choose your own adventure! Hunt or fish, shop for antiques, dig for diamonds, enjoy wildlife, peruse art there’s something for everyone.

The cultural and arts scenes in Arkansas are booming. New art destinations seem to be opening almost daily.
